lines.content: > 'He who fails to plan is planning to fail' -- Winston Churchill
DukePro is a task planner that is *free*, download it from [here](https://github.com/liujiayue314/ip/releases/tag/A-Jar).
Programmers can also use it in intelliJ, by running `main` method.
It frees your mind of having to remember things you need to do. It's

assertEquals("[D][ ] testDeadline (by: Jan-01-2023)", Deadline.toString(), "toString() when not done works");
assertEquals("[D][X] testDeadline (by: Jan-01-2023)", Deadline.toString(), "toString() when done works");
Event Event = new Event("testEvent", LocalDate.of(2023, 1, 1), LocalDate.of(2023, 2, 1));
assertEquals("[E][ ] testEvent (from: Jan-01-2023 to: Feb-01-2023)", Event.toString(), "toString() when not done works");
assertEquals("[E][X] testEvent (from: Jan-01-2023 to: Feb-01-2023)", Event.toString(), "toString() when done works");
assertEquals("T|testTodo|0", todo.toText(), "toText() when not done works");
assertEquals("[T][ ] testTodo", todo.toString(), "toString() when not done works");
assertEquals("[T][X] testTodo", todo.toString(), "toString() when done works");
